intro: Berkheya barbata, commonly known as the barbed berkheya, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, barbed bracts that give it its common name. Berkheya barbata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
